intro: Banisteria acanthocarpa var. glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular banisteria, is a climbing shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with glandular dots. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
